title: FEMA Audit (Fema Region 2)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Court records show allege that a FEMA employee was asked to participate in a false report regarding LIDAR applications for DR-4339-PR (Hurricane María): https://www.courtlistener.com/docket/68106635/6/maneiro-v-mayorkas/

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Any records regarding the use of light detection and ranging (LIDAR) for DR-4339-PR. 

2) Communications, emails, text messages, and attachments regarding the use or possible applications for LIDAR for DR-4339-PR. 

3)  Any presentations, presentation attachments, and instructional materials (these include but are not limited to audio, video, PowerPoint presentations, and slide formats) concerning use or possible applications for LIDAR for DR-4339-PR. 

Keywords: "DR-4339-PR" "LIDAR" "Hurricane Irma" "Hurricane María" "Puerto Rico" "LIDAR applications"

This request is for all records produced between January 1, 2017 and the time this request is processed.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am an independent journalist and documents obtained by this request will be used in the course of reporting on the aftermath of Hurricane Maria.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request email communications between UGA PD, Jere Morehead, S. Jack Hu,
Michelle G. Cook, Rebecca Scarboro, Brett Malone, and P. Daniel Silk and the Georgia Governor's office, any communications referencing any discussions with the Office of the Georgia Governor between UGA PD and the above parties (or any representative thereof), and any communications between the above parties amongst themselves (or any representatives thereof), from April 1, 2024 until current date (5/2/24). title: FEDERAL WAY SCHOOL DISTRICT - Request for digital copies of all internet video call recordings in the District's care, custody, or control recorded between the dates 01-01-20 through 05-01-24

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: FEDERAL WAY SCHOOL DISTRICT - Request for digital copies of all internet video call recordings in the District's care, custody, or control recorded between the dates 01-01-20 through 05-01-24
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Digital copies of all video recordings of internet-based video calls, meetings, training sessions, town halls, school board meetings, and google classroom sessions in the District's care, custody, or control recorded between the dates 01-01-20 through 05-01-24.

To clarify, if the District is in possession of any digital recordings of Zoom meeting calls, Skype Sessions, Google Duo calls, Slack, Gotomeeting, etc. (any recorded internet-based video communication/presentation/instruction product) for the period of time 01-01-20 through 05-01-24 I am requesting a digital copy to be produced via internet web link.

The District search for these digitally recorded videos should include all computers and digital storage devices owned, operated, or controlled by the District.

The District search for these digitally recorded videos should also include a search of all computers and digital storage devices owned, operated, or controlled by District employees if the digital video was recorded on equipment provided to the employee by the District, or if the digital video recording contains content relating to District agency related matters.

I request the digital video files to be delivered unedited whenever possible and in the original digital file format in which the files were originally recorded and stored.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anon Request

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: May 1, 2023 "Explosive Artifact" at LUMA Office in Puerto Rico (Fbi - Puerto Rico)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports show that there was an "explosive artifact" found near the offices of LUMA Energy in Guayama, Puerto Rico on May 1, 2023: https://www.elnuevodia.com/noticias/seguridad/notas/policia-desactiva-artefacto-explosivo-encontrado-en-las-inmediaciones-de-las-oficinas-de-luma-energy-en-guayama/

Joseph González, director of the FBI for Puerto Rico and USVI, spoke with local Puerto Rican newspapers about whether the item was a real bomb or not: https://www.metro.pr/noticias/2023/05/03/fbi-no-confirma-si-artefacto-encontrado-en-luma-era-una-bomba/

Additionally, through my own reporting, I confirmed with the Puerto Rico Police Department that the artifacts and documents related to it were handed over to the FBI on or around May 2, 2023.

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Any communications, emails, text messages, and attachments concerning an item resembling the artifact found near the offices of LUMA Energy in Guayama, Puerto Rico on May 1, 2023. Please included any communications and attachments between FBI personnel, as well as those exchanged with local Puerto Rican agencies, such as the Puerto Rico Police Department or the Municipality of Guayama.

2) Any after action reports or documentation created in response to the aforementioned incident. These should include but are not limited to write ups, executive summaries, and complaints.

3) Any pictures or videos produced in response to the aforementioned incident.

This request is for all records produced from April 30, 2023 to the date this request is processed.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am a Puerto Rican journalist and all responsive records will be used in the course of reporting about May Day actions in Puerto Rico.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Arrest Record/Surveillance Video
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please be advised that we represent Christian Tsoutsouris for personal injuries he sustained on 9/8/23 in front of 113 McDougal Street, NY NY.     NYSID 6047361N
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Law, we are requesting the following information: 
1 - All records, reports of violent assault that occurred on 9/8/23, in front of a bar located at the above referenced location;
2 - Any other documents relating to this accident;
3 – Any arrest reports for Roger Scott related to the occurrence on 9/8/23
3 - Any photos taken at the above-referenced location on the date of the subject incident; 
4 - A copy of any internal accident reports pertaining to the above-referenced.   
5.   Aided report
6.  Surveillance video obtained from Minetta Tavern as part of the investigation.   
Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lisa Michael

communications.subject: You have an invoice available :: S338192-050124
communications.communication:
RE:  Public Records Request#: S338192-050124 
 
Dear Emma Parry, 
 
 PAYMENT DUE 
 
The City may be the custodian of at least some of the requested public records and a payment is due to continue processing this request. Please log into the Portland Public Records Request Center to pay these fees. 
 
Fees include research time to locate and analyze the requested records, even if no records are located or if the requested records are determined to be exempt from disclosure. We will not be working on your request until we receive the payment. 
 
Please log in to the Portland Public Records Request Center (copy and right click this link to open it in your browser) and make a payment on this request. 
 
You may pay by electronic check or credit card by going to "My Public Records Request Center" and select "View My Invoices." Then scroll to find your open invoice and select "Make Payment." Follow the screen prompts to make a payment. 
 
Due to the current state of emergency, most City offices are not staffed. Consequently, if you mail a check it could delay the response time and it is preferable that you use the online payment portal to make an electronic payment. However, if you need to mail a check, please reply to this message and ask for the correct address. Please be sure and provide your Reference Number (S338192-050124) on your check. 
 
Please be advised that pursuant to ORS 192.329(3)(b) and (4)(b), your public records request will be closed if payment is not received within sixty (60) days of this invoice. 
 
 
Sincerely, 
 
 
City of Portland Public Records Responder 
 
 
 *Please note that you will need to disable your pop-up blocker on your browser's settings in order to make an online payment.
*Please see this Answer for more information:  A006257-010816 If you are having technical difficulties with the website, please contact the website administrator by phone or email.  (503) 823-6040 or prrhelp@portlandoregon.gov

communications.subject: Police General Records Request :: S338192-050124
communications.communication:
Dear Emma: 
 
The City of Portland acknowledges receipt of your Public Records Request.  Your request was received in this office on May 01, 2024 and given the reference number S338192-050124 for tracking purposes. 
 
Record Requested:  To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A tabular data file containing all information collected in accordance with Oregon § 131.935 including but not limited to: date of stop, time of stop, race of driver, gender of driver, age of driver, if search occurred, if contraband was found, anonymized officer ID, and stop location for all years available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Emma Parry

At this time, the City is uncertain whether it is the custodian of the requested record.  The City will review your request to determine if it has responsive records.  The City will then gather an estimate of the costs to provide copies of requested public records for which the City does not claim an exemption from disclosure.  The City is permitted to charge its actual costs to provide records.  Fees include research time to locate and analyze the requested records, even if no records are located or if the requested records are determined to be exempt from disclosure. 
 
Please be advised that a pre-payment from you may be required.  If a pre-payment is required, you will receive a separate notice with instructions.  You may click here to access the payments page.

title: Count of Competency Evaluations

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Count of Competency Evaluations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

My request pertains to obtaining information from the regarding data from Office of the Executive Secretary concerning  records of reimbursements for court-ordered competency evaluations. Specifically, I am requesting monthly counts of court-ordered competency evaluations by court, if such data is available. If monthly counts are not available, then annual counts for each court are acceptable. I would like this data for as far back as the Office of the Executive Secretary has it available. If this data can be separated into just competency evaluations vs combination competency and sanity at the time of offense evaluations, then I would ask that these counts go in separate columns.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Brandon Morrissey.

title: Puerto Rico Training Exercise March 15, 2024 (United States Marine Corps)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Puerto Rico Training Exercise March 15, 2024 (United States Marine Corps)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports show that Puerto Rico National Guard participated in joint exercises with Army and Marine groups that took place on or about March 15, 2024 https://www.nationalguard.mil/News/Article-View/Article/3724579/puerto-rico-guard-partners-with-sister-services-in-joint-exercise/

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Any communications, emails, text messages, and attachments exchanged between your department and other military departments involved in the training exercise (including but not limited to: US Army, Marines, US Navy, US Army Reserve).

2) Any communications, emails, text messages, and attachments exchanged between your department and Puerto Rican government agencies who had knowledge of the training exercise (including but not limited to: Puerto Rico Police Department and Office of the Governor (La Fortaleza)).

3) Any presentations, presentation attachments, and instructional materials (these include but are not limited to audio, video, PowerPoint presentations, and slide formats) concerning the training exercise that took place in Puerto Rico on or about March 15, 2024

4) Any maps used in the planning of and during the training exercise that took place in Puerto Rico on or about March 15, 2024.

This request is for all records produced between January 1, 2024 and the time this request is processed.

This request is not being used for commercial purposes. I am an independent journalist and documents obtained by this request will be used in the course of reporting on military exercises in Puerto Rico

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

If you do not already have a SecureRelease portal account you can sign-up (https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/) here, just make sure to use 162966-15579894@requests.muckrock.com when you sign up to gain access to your request details. (https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/) 

Should you have an inquiry related to your SecureRelease user account or concerning www.securerelease.us, please email SecureRelease Support and a member of our team will be happy to assist. (https://www.securerelease.us/) 
 

Take care, 

 
SecureRelease™ Support (Contractor) 
securereleasepublicsupport@deloitte.com  Do NOT respond to this email. The SecureRelease™ Support desk is not operated by a FOIA Office or Agency personnel, and does not process requests--please do not send request details, supporting documentation, or other sensitive information to this inbox. Additionally, please note that SecureRelease™ Support is unable to provide updates concerning the processing, status, or timeline of requests, nor can we offer guidance with regard to agency procedures. For these inquiries, please contact the Agency or refer to their website.

title: Puerto Rico CISA Assessments

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Puerto Rico CISA Assessments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports show that Puerto Rico has been the subject of several "hacks" over the last three years: 
https://www.notiuno.com/noticias/puerto-rico-sufre-m-s-de-450-millones-de-ataques-cibern-ticos-a-hospitales-y/article_c58ff970-425e-11ee-b181-e378c3b1bbfc.html 
https://www.nbcnews.com/news/latino/cyberattack-cripples-puerto-rico-toll-collection-system-rcna24993

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) All records produced through risk and vulnerability assessments (RVA), critical infrastructure assessments, or any other type of assessments done on the security of Puerto Rican government agencies' digital systems.

2) Any presentations, presentation attachments, and instructional materials (these include but are not limited to audio, video, PowerPoint presentations, and slide formats) concerning the results of these assessments meant to explain these findings to Puerto Rican government officials.

3) Any communications, messages, emails, and attachments between your department and Puerto Rican government agencies (including but not limited to: Puerto Rico Police Department, Office of the Governor (La Fortaleza), and the Municipality of San Juan) concerning the results of these assessments.

This request is for all records produced between January 1, 2022 and the time this request is processed.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am an independent journalist and the documents obtained through this request will be used in the course of reporting about cyber security vulnerabilities within Puerto Rico.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

title: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Yuba County

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any information regarding the total number of active unidentified deceased persons cases ("John Doe" or "Jane Doe" cases) that the Yuba County Coroner's Office (https://www.yuba.org/departments/sheriff-coroner/index.php) is currently responsible for, dating from the earliest possible case on record, to the active case opened the closest of the date that this request is received.

Please conduct the broadest possible search for any information (excel files, PowerPoint Presentations, Word documents, PDFs, email correspondence with the DOJ's NamUs program, CJIS correspondence, NCIC correspondence, etc.) that would help to definitively state the total number of unidentified deceased persons that the Yuba County Sheriff-Coroner's Office is responsible for.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Tuolumne County

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Tuolumne County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any information regarding the total number of active unidentified deceased persons cases ("John Doe" or "Jane Doe" cases) that the Tuolumne County Coroner's Office (https://www.tuolumnecounty.ca.gov/344/CivilCoronerRecords-Section) is currently responsible for, dating from the earliest possible case on record, to the active case opened the closest of the date that this request is received.

Please conduct the broadest possible search for any information (excel files, PowerPoint Presentations, Word documents, PDFs, email correspondence with the DOJ's NamUs program, CJIS correspondence, NCIC correspondence, etc.) that would help to definitively state the total number of unidentified deceased persons that the Tuolumne County Coroner's Office is responsible for.

I research missing and unidentified person cases as a hobby, and I am curious as to why Merced, Fresno, Mariposa, Stanislaus, and other California counties report unidentified person cases yet Tuolumne does not. I am curious to know how many (total number) and the circumstances of any cases in Tuolumne County - if they exist.

Thank you for the Tuolumne County Sheriff's Office for their commitment to transparency.

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) Any communications sent to or received from administration or staff at Emerson College on April 24, 25, or 26, 2024.

2) Any communications sent to or received from the Emory College Police Department on April 24, 25, or 26, 2024. 

3) Any report concerning arrests or other interactions with demonstrators at or near Emerson College on April 25, 2024.

4) Any communications sent to or received from administration or staff at Northeastern University on April 26, 27, or 28, 2024.

5) Any report concerning arrests or other interactions with demonstrators at or near Northeastern University on April 27, 2024. 

Please also note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on personal cell phones or social media accounts used to conduct public business.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

title: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Siskiyou County

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Siskiyou County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any information regarding the total number of active unidentified deceased persons cases ("John Doe" or "Jane Doe" cases) that the Siskiyou County Sheriff's Office (https://www.co.siskiyou.ca.us/sheriff/page/coroners-office) is currently responsible for, dating from the earliest possible case on record, to the active case opened the closest of the date that this request is received.

Please conduct the broadest possible search for any information (excel files, PowerPoint Presentations, Word documents, PDFs, email correspondence with the DOJ's NamUs program, CJIS correspondence, NCIC correspondence, etc.) that would help to definitively state the total number of unidentified deceased persons that the Siskiyou County Sheriff's Office is responsible for. If the number is zero as of the date that this request is received, then publicly state this.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Emory University

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Emory University
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Any communications sent to or received from Emory University administration or staff on April 24, 25 or 26, 2024. 

2) Any communications sent to or received from the Emory University Police Department on April 24, 25, or 26, 2024. 

3) Any report concerning arrests or other interactions with demonstrators at or near Emory University on April 25, 2024.

Please also note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on personal cell phones or social media accounts used to conduct public business.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Burns

title: ReKor Records

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: ReKor Records
communications.communication:
To the FOIA Officer of Niles Police Department Illinois,

This request is made under the provisions of Illinois Freedom of Information Act. for the following records:

All documents pertaining to ReKor (https://www.rekor.ai/) license-plate-reader hardware and/or software. Documents being requested here should include - but are not limited to - the following:

- Invoices, receipts, and/or requests for the purchase of any ReKor product/service
- MOUs from ReKor
- Brochures or product/service specifications regarding ReKor
- Privacy and/or retention policies regarding ReKor product/services
- Any/all manuals regarding ReKor product/services
- Guidelines mentioning ReKor product/services
- Bulletins mentioning ReKor product/services
- Briefings mentioning ReKor product/services
- Any/all digitally disseminated publications from your agency mentioning ReKor product/services

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the case of any applicable fees, it is requested that an estimate of the total charges be provided prior to fulfilling this request. The preferred method of receipt is through electronic delivery.

Your assistance and cooperation in this matter are greatly appreciated. A response within 5 business days, as the statute requires days of this request is anticipated.

With thanks,

David S. (he/him/his), Lucy Parsons Labs
